info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 28 at 2:18PM CDT until March 30 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Duluth MN
info.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, freezing rain expected. Total ice accumulations around one tenth of an inch. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow and sleet accumulations between 3 and 6 inches and ice accumulations around three tenths of an inch possible.
* WHERE...Iron County. This includes the Tribal Lands of the northwestern area of the Lac du Flambeau Band.
* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 PM this evening to 7 AM CDT Saturday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Saturday evening through Sunday evening.
* IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel could be nearly impossible. Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction:
Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
Slow down and use caution while traveling. Prepare for possible power outages. Call 511 or visit www.511wi.gov for Wisconsin road information.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING
